column4: Hey guys, I'm running gutsy on an HP laptop. I'm using ndiswrapper to get wireless with wpasupplicant, and it does work. The only problem I have, is that every time I login, I have to open the network manager and clear out and type my passkey back in to get it to reconnect
Any ideas? I'm almost to the point that I'm going to write a short shell script to run the iwconfig commands manually.
try sudo modprobe -r bcm43xx then sudo modprobe bcm43xx
I think that it has found the wireless card correctly, it certainly knows how to use it. It's just isn't convenient.
